column4: im running now xubuntu from live cd but when trying to install i have message in 70 % that my cd is damaged
i want burn new image on new cd but i cannot remove cd in live system how to do it
there is option in installation cd to teest ubuntu
but i want install it permanently but i have error that my cd is damaged in 70 % of install process
so how can i burn image then
Do you have a recovery CD from your old system?
Do you have some sort of recovery CD from your old system? A lot of computers come with these.
Since you are running from the CD you cannot unmount the CD to burn another CD.
No, the CD is crap, not ubuntu.
Go to http://www.ubuntu.com/ and order a CD from them.
You've overwritten it. there is no way to access your windows partion simply because it does not exist now.
it does exist i didnt format it but ubuntu overwrite boot sector
You cannot remove livecd because your computer is using it to run. It would be like trying to remove the HDD.
In future, test your CD's before you use them to overwrite your partitions.
